intro: Pseudocymopterus montanus, commonly known as the mountain cymopterus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a fern-like appearance, while its small white flowers bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
